headline: What Campbell's (CPB)'s La Regina Stake and New Debt Issue Mean for Shareholders
summary: Earlier this week, The Campbell's Company reported fiscal first-quarter 2026 results showing sales of US$2,677 million and net income of US$194 million, while reaffirming flat-to-slightly-changing organic net sales guidance and announcing a US$548.812 million fixed-income offering via 4.550% senior unsecured notes due March 21, 2031. At the same time, Campbell’s moved to deepen control over its fast-growing Rao’s sauce franchise through a US$286 million deal for a 49% stake in supplier La...

headline: Assessing Campbell Soup (CPB) Valuation After Mixed Q1, Guidance Reaffirmation and La Regina Stake Purchase
summary: Campbell's (CPB) just reported a mixed first quarter, with sales and profit sliding but full year guidance left intact, and paired the update with a 49% stake in Rao's producer La Regina. See our latest analysis for Campbell's. Those mixed results, together with fresh cost savings targets, new fixed-rate debt and the La Regina deal, come against a tough backdrop, with a roughly 32% year to date share price return decline and a three year total shareholder return near minus 44%. This suggests...
